result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcahrge, plus costs and disbursements.  Monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain HSED or GED. Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with Jane S., Amber W., Pick N Save at 4155 N. Oakland Avenue, Shorewood, WI; or George Webb at 3133 S. 92 Street, Milwaukee, WI.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs.  Take as prescribed and only for as long as deemd medically reasonable and necessary.
No alcohol.
No contact with codefendasnt JB Hankins.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample ordered in case 15CF17354.
The Court advised defendasnt that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominic Somk Panhyasiri

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (30 pages) commencing JULY 28, 2015 received and filed. kl
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be assigned to Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA IN BRANCH 24.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another Scheduling conference.   Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant facing possible new charges; parties request another scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court is not in session on 4/17/15 at 1:30 p.m.  Case is rescheduled for plea and sentencing before Branch 20 on 4/22/15 at 1:30 p.m. Bailiffs notified of same.  File retained in court.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  File retained in court.

Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  
Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri in custody.  
Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: House Of Correction 8885 S 68th Street, Franklin, WI 53132
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
